department: Public Works and Government Services Canada
short_summary: Purchase for six two-person commercial-off-the-shelf inflatable boats over the first 3 years, with options to purchase up to four additional boats in Years 4 and 5. Deliverables to be delivered to Natural Resources Canada in Ottawa, Ontario
description: Traders will provide six certified inflatable boats for a specified duration.
full_summary:
### Inflatable Boats Tender Notice
#### Solicitation Number: 23239-240287/A
#### Publication Date: October 13, 2023
#### Tender Closing Date: November 7, 2023, 14:00 EST

**Contract Overview**
Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC) on behalf of Natural Resources Canada (NRCan) is seeking the purchase of six (6) two-person commercial-off-the-shelf (COTS) inflatable boats over a three-year period, with the option to purchase up to four additional boats in the following two years. The boats must be delivered to NRCan in Ottawa, Ontario by March 31st of each year.

**Eligibility and Qualification**
Only suppliers with an existing Supply Arrangement (SA) for small boats are eligible to compete for this tender. New suppliers must first qualify for an SA, with details available on [CanadaBuys](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/). 

**Tender Details**
This tender is governed by the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) and is not subject to security requirements. Inquiries must be submitted to Heureuse Saint-Juste at heureuse.saint-juste@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca. The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.

**Tender Documents**
Tender documents are available on [CanadaBuys](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/). Interested suppliers must submit their proposals in accordance with the instructions outlined in the tender documents.

**Contact Information**
For any inquiries regarding this tender, please contact Heureuse Saint-Juste at heureuse.saint-juste@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca.

### Changes to the Original Tender Notice
Amendment 001 was issued on November 1, 2023, to extend the tender closing date to November 7, 2023.

In rewriting this text, ensure to remove any irrelevant or redundant information, catch any grammatical errors, and improve the clarity and readability of the rewritten text. Make sure to maintain a professional tone and adhere to standard technical writing best practices.  Word count: 350.
